content:
It's always a good idea to understand the cancellation and change policies for a restaurant, especially when making a reservation for a large group.

**Cancellation Policy:** Foreign Cinema has a 24-hour cancellation policy. If you need to cancel or reduce the size of your party, you must notify them at least 24 hours in advance to avoid any penalties. If you cancel within 24 hours, they may charge a cancellation fee, which can vary depending on the size of your group and the time of year.

**Change Policy:** If you need to make changes to your reservation, such as reducing the number of guests or changing the date/time, it's best to contact Foreign Cinema as soon as possible. They'll do their best to accommodate changes, but please note that they may not always be able to accommodate last-minute changes.

**How to Cancel or Make Changes:** To cancel or make changes to your reservation, you can:

1. **Call them directly**: Reach out to Foreign Cinema's reservation line at (415) 861-8135.
2. **Email them**: You can also send an email to [reservations@foreigncinema.com](mailto:reservations@foreigncinema.com) with your reservation details and changes.
3. **Use online platforms**: If you made the reservation through OpenTable or another online platform, you may be able to cancel or modify your reservation through their website or app.

**Important:** When canceling or making changes, be sure to get a confirmation from Foreign Cinema to ensure they've received your request.

By understanding their policy, you can plan ahead and avoid any potential penalties or issues. If you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to reach out to Foreign Cinema directly. They're always happy to help.
